intro: Alseodaphne glauciflora, commonly known as the white-flowered laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often found in lowland and hill forest areas. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
